page.title: 19Religion
page.content: The{Methodists}and the{Church of {England}members (the most predominant groups in the area),are served by ministers living in the locality, whereas the{Roman Catholics}are served by priests in Tavistock. In Latchley/ Chilsworthy,Methodists attend services in the chapel in Chilsworthy,while C.of E. members travel to the Parish Church of St. Andrew,in Calstock. Catholics travel either to Gunnislake or Callington.The different churches hold occasional inter-denominational services to foster links.They also combine to raise Christian Aid for the third world countries.The number of baptisms seems to be decreasing but church weddings remain very popular. Burials are in local graveyards but cremations take place in Plymouth,the latter seems preferable to non-locals.
